job_description: Business Requirements Analyst - job post Forward Slope Inc. 18 reviews San Diego, CA 92108 $90,000 - $105,000 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $90,000 - $105,000 a year Job Type Full-time Forward Slope has an open position for a full-time Business Requirement Analyst to join our Enterprise Solutions Team. This position is located in San Diego, CA. Forward Slope is seeking a Business Analyst with strong software skills. This position will be working directly with the Department of Navy to provide business process, strategy development, analysis, and project management support. The ideal candidate for this position must be a self-starter with the ability to work effectively independently and in team settings to include close collaboration with program managers and federal clients. Salary Range: $90,000-$105,000 Duties include/Job Description: Analyze and formulate customer software requirements and analytical support. Review and creation of requirements into user stories. Provide mockups used to clarify and validate use-case scenarios for customers and developers Execution of requirements reviews. Provides analytical support to a specific group of customers on business applications, processes, infrastructure, and technology related activities. Works to identify business application and process improvement opportunities, submitting recommendations to clients for consideration. Acts as a key project/workgroup team member, specifically in value identification and measurement, requirements definition and testing activities. Provides guidance, assistance, coordination, and follow-up on complex problems and ensures resolution. Develops and distributes communication materials that assist with adoption of application and process enhancements. Works with application developers and operations to support production applications and customer-specific operations. Work with application developers to verify that solutions are implemented as required Maps complex business processes and communicates process solutions to the client. Documents standard processes and work products. Drafts manuals, business case analyses, reports, whitepapers, standard operating procedure, and other complex documents. Reviews and analyzes strategy, vision, policy, lessons learned and other key documents and provides strategy recommendations. Required Qualifications: Requires Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or related field or equivalent. Ability to be adaptable and self-motivated and work independently. 7+ years of experience with data management or using information management systems; preferably with the DoD. Experience in working with project management tools. Experience with business intelligence and data reporting tools. Experience with process flow design in SharePoint or Visio. Possession of excellent presentation and client service skills. Possession of excellent organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills. MS Office proficient. Desired Qualifications: (If any) Working knowledge of Agile Methodology Familiarity with SPIDER Applications / Processes Other Requirements: Must have an active Security Secret Clearance. Forward Slope Inc., is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disable **The listed pay scale reflects the broad, minimum to maximum, pay scale for this position for the location for which it has been posted and is not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Other compensation considerations may include, but are not limited to, job responsibilities, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, or other applicable factors. If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Business Objects Analyst - job post RIVET OPERATIONS CO. San Diego, CA Full-time, Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Part-time JOB DESCRIPTION JOB DESCRIPTION Position Title: Business Object Enterprise (BoE) Analyst Location: San Diego, CA Duration: Long term contract Security Clearance: Must possess a DOD Secret clearance The Analyst shall assess and optimize the Business Intelligence (BI) environment to support information discovery, integration and sharing of information. The Analyst shall define measures, metrics, dashboards and support analytical architecture necessary to monitor, manage and support sound decisions for the enterprise data environment. The Analyst shall analyze the business processes and develop models for subsequent use; develop data models in support of the various applications required. Further, the Analyst shall review documented requirements and present specific design recommendations to address the business and data requirements in terms of viability and impact on existing and new processes. The Analyst shall identify required data elements; define associated metadata and sources to support these and any requirements. The Analyst must be able to communicate these requirements fluently to Government and other personnel (Knowledge Transfer). The Analyst shall support the Business Objects Enterprise community. The Analyst shall have up-to-date training to meet Cybersecurity requirements to include but not limited to Security+ and Certified Business Intelligence Professional. The Business Objects Enterprise Analyst shall; Contribute to all technical aspects of building and maintaining Business Objects data warehouse Create technical specifications for data conversion of Discoverer and Oracle reports to BOE Interface with Data Modeler to build warehouse and tables for supplemental data Review effectiveness of interfaces for accuracy and proper timing with ETL team Develop Universes, and coordinated changes with other Universe Designers Add definitions and source data to all elements of Universes Coordinate efforts with Programmers to write/test scripts for mass data clean-up projects Create, test and monitor reports and charts for local and Enterprise users Research problems using SQL to determine correct source for resolution Process all levels of Life Cycle Management documentation Summary: Reporting to the Business Intelligence Center of Excellence for the FRC, this BI and Reporting role will oversee data and reporting for FRC operations and collaborate with senior leadership to provide analytical support of data-driven decision making. This person will also work closely with key executives and stakeholders to deliver essential reporting and data, while providing a vision for enhancing data driven, evidence-based decisions at executive, managerial, and operations levels. JOB REQUIREMENTS JOB REQUIREMENTS Education and Experience: Bachelor Degree (data science, cognitive science, computer science, engineering, psychology) 5+ years in demonstrated leadership roles managing complex reporting and BI platforms 7+ years of full lifecycle data warehousing experience Experience with SAP BOE and at least one other industry-leading business intelligence platforms, such as Qlik, Tableau, MS Power BI, Cognos, DOMO, or similar modern in-memory BI solution. Strong technical knowledge of data management systems, data modeling, database design, data quality, and data governance Must have significant experience in data warehousing, data visualization, and business intelligence Preferred education in User-Centered Design, Human Computer Interaction or UX Design Required Skills: Ability to create and modify reports using the Business Objects BI4 Ability to crate and modify reports using the Crystal Reports XI Ability to create and modify Dashboards using the Business Objects BI4 tools (Xcelsius) Experience in providing Mobile Dashboard Solutions Ability to create and modify new and existing report using Crystal Reports XI Ability to perform End User trainings and assist with the development of online training Mentor development teams in universe and report design, development and implementation Knowledge of Data Warehouse data modeling principles and techniques (Kimball is preferred) Ability to comprehend and develop complex SQL /PLSQL in an Oracle environment Support troubleshooting of issues within the Business Intelligence environment Employed vast knowledge of relational database concepts and Oracle PL/SQL coding to produce BOE reports and IDT universes. Developed and generated ad-hoc and customized reports in BOE/IDT to evaluate specific business requirements for the COMFRC enterprise. Analyzed data in the datamart and in BOE reports to identify root causes of problems and recommend corrective actions. Collaborated with system architects, data modelers and others to understand COMFRC and industry requirements. Monitored resolution of bugs, tested fixes and helped report developers tackle ongoing problems. Converted and Migrated Reports/BO Universes to support NERP effort Worked with Scrum team to test and certify BOE reports and data modeling changes before deploying to production. Operated under Agile and Scrum frameworks to complete releases and well-organized sprints. Cultivated interpersonal skills by building positive relationships with others. Tool-set used on site: SAP Business Intelligence (Business Objects) Oracle SQL /PLSQL TOAD and SQLNavigator Informatica (ETL Tool) CA Erwin (Data Modeling tool) Physical Requirements Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods of time. Position may require typing and reading from a computer screen. Must have sufficient mobility, including but not limited to bending, reaching, and kneeling to complete daily duties in a timely and efficient manner. There is a possibility that due to parking availability and location of work, walking moderate to long distance may be required. Possible lifting up to 25 lbs. Please note: Rivet Operations Company LLC reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Positions functions and qualifications may vary depending on business needs. Rivet Operations Company LLC is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, creed, religion, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or Vietnam era, or other eligible veteran status or legally protected characteristics.

Senior Business Systems Analyst - job post San Ysidro Health 144 reviews San Diego, CA 92173 $41.59 - $62.50 an hour -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $41.59 - $62.50 an hour Job Type Full-time Position Summary: The Sr. Business Analyst provides an advanced level of business analysis support for the organization’s strategic initiatives. The focus of this position is to work closely with project teams as well as individual business units to gain an in-depth understanding of current and proposed business processes and services to identify and address operational, financial and technological gaps. The Sr. Business Analyst will support a variety of projects by leading efforts to define requirements, identify desired state, document process gaps, research and propose solutions, and work with other project team members to pilot and implement approved projects. Success is determined by each initiative’s alignment with strategic direction, meeting of key performance indicators, and business adoption. In addition, the Sr. Business Analyst will use his or her expertise to lead other analysts in best practices for reviewing and documenting business processes from end-to-end, identifying business needs and determining solutions that align with the organization’s strategic direction. Essential Functions of the Job: Analyzes and recommends solutions for complex business problems Interprets business needs and translates them into technical or operational requirements Creates end-to-end workflow documentation for current and new processes Collaborates with business units to modify or implement processes for optimal efficiency Supports and aligns efforts with strategic direction of the organization Elicits requirements using interviews, documentation analysis, workgroups, existing use cases and workflow analysis Facilitates workflow reviews with business units and project teams, including presenting and interpreting analysis results, summarizing conclusions and recommending course of action Stays current with business needs and strategies; utilizing formal and informal written communication methods (for example, emails, newsletters, presentations, executive updates, task lists, etc.) to communicate updates and findings; facilitates project meetings and presentations to all types of diverse audiences including senior management and technical staff Provides complete project level support – producing required project analysis documentation (business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, UAT plan); adjusting schedules when necessary; determining daily priorities; ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; following proper escalation paths; and managing stakeholder relationships Provides leadership to team members and peers by collaborating with others; articulating ideas and viewpoints as appropriate; identifying and initiating projects; driving the resolution of issues; and holding self and team accountable for results Integrates new systems and processes with existing ones; and partnering with internal and external teams and vendors to ensure systems provided meet the long-term business strategies Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions by managing stakeholder expectations, carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilities Identifies ways to increase adoption and customer satisfaction Analyzes and synthesize business requirements, including recognizing patterns and conceptualizing processes Serves as a liaison between Operations and IT to assist or gather business requirements needed for system modifications, enhancement and implementations Assists with and tests software implementations for project-related solutions to ensure team member and provider experience is appropriate Creates and maintain issue logs, meeting minutes, meeting schedules, project summaries and updates; provides timely reporting of issues that impact project progress, coordinating actions and resolving conflicts Meets with business owners and project teams regularly to review project deliverables and deadlines Develops and executes test plans as required Additional Duties and Responsibilities Adheres to all applicable SYHealth policies, procedures, protocols and best practices. Demonstrates effective verbal and written communication skills in collaboration with teams to achieve quality, excellence, harmony and problem-solving to obtain stated goals and objectives. Demonstrates active listening skills, respect and a positive “Can Do” attitude. Enhances professional growth and development through participation in educational programs, reading literature to keep up-to-date related to Healthcare laws and Leadership, attending in-service trainings and workshops to improve upon knowledge and skillset. Performs any other job-related duties as needed, assigned or requested Job Requirements Education Required: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science or related field Experience Required: 5 years of experience in a lead or senior business analyst role Experience Preferred: 10 years of experience with functional and business systems analysis and information technology support which includes experience with planning and business case development Verbal and Written Skills Required to Perform the Job: Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills while presenting ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language Excellent listening skills as well as written and oral communication skills Strong facilitative leadership, communication, documentation, and influencing ability Outstanding communication skills with the ability to work with individuals at all levels of the organization, including senior leadership and key stakeholders Technical Knowledge and Skills Required to Perform the Job: Must have experience working on large scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from the business Strong project management, ability to successfully manage multiple tasks at any given point, strong relationship building skills & communication skills Understanding of process improvement methodologies, fundamentals and analytical data Ability to maintain a detail oriented mindset while innovating new solutions to existing problems Demonstrated problem-solving skills with an ability to anticipate future issues Familiarity with the software development lifecycle (SDLC) process Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, Visio and PowerPoint Problem Solving Process Improvement Communication Leadership Teamwork Vendor Management Business Operations, preferably in healthcare Equipment Used: Computers, Software systems, Office equipment Working Conditions and Physical Requirements: Flexibility in schedule to meet project deadlines Sitting for extended periods of time Sufficient dexterity to effectively operate a computer keyboard and other related peripherals Reliable home internet connection Universal Requirements: Pre-employment requirements include I-9, physical, positive background and reference check results, complete application, new hire orientation, pre-employment PPDs. Compliance with all mandated vaccinations and all boosters is a term and condition of employment. About Us San Ysidro Health is a Federally Qualified Health Care organization committed to providing high quality, compassionate, accessible and affordable healthcare services for the entire family. The organization was founded by seven women in search of medical services for their families and community. Almost 50 years later, San Ysidro Health now provides innovative care to over 108,000 patients through a vast and integrated network of 47 program sites across the county. San Ysidro Health could not serve our patients without the dedication of our passionate and hardworking employees. Apply today and become a part of our mission-driven team! San Ysidro Health has a long-standing commitment to equal employment opportunity for all applicants for employment. Employment decisions including, but not limited to, those such as employee selection, performance evaluation, administration of benefits, working conditions, employee programs, transfers, position changes, training, disciplinary action, compensation, and separations are made without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming), creed, national origin, nationality, citizenship status, domestic partnership status, ancestry, gender, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, civil union status, family status, age, mental or physical disability (including AIDS or HIV-related status), atypical heredity cellular or blood trait of an individual, genetic information or refusal to submit to a genetic test or make available the results of a genetic test, military status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

Senior Business Analyst – Research Administration and Compliance - job post Streamlyne San Diego, CA • Remote Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Job Type: Full Time Streamlyne is a dynamic, fast-growing SaaS company that partners with university research departments and independent research institutions. We are seeking multi-functional, experienced Senior Business Analysts that have worked in the trenches, possess strong leadership qualities, and have the ambition to keep pace with our growth trajectory. With this unique offering in a highly competitive space, we are seeking someone highly skilled to join our adventure, partner with great clients, and help us reach new heights. We are looking for individuals with functional experience in Research Administration and/or Compliance that have been heavily involved in an IT systems implementation. Streamlyne offers modules to support Pre-Award (including System-to-System proposal submission), Negotiations, Post-Award (including Subaward), IRB, IACUC, IBC, Conflict of Interest, and Export Control. Expertise in multiple areas is highly preferred. Candidates that have led an implementation will be given top priority consideration. This position will be aligned with a team of like-minded multi-functional Business Analysts (BAs). Business Analysts at Streamlyne are customer-facing, play many important roles, and have significant impact on the growth of the company and improvement of its products. Senior BAs will play lead roles within team projects, including all implementations. A fully-trained member of the BA Team is expected to contribute as follows: Marketing Duties Complete RFP responses and/or coordinate the assignment and management of RFP tasks with teammates. Execute software demonstrations within your area of expertise and/or coordinate participation from other analysts in demonstrations as required. Travel to onsite demonstrations as requested (usually with other team members), manage onsite technology, and manage prospect relationships/follow-up. Coordinate prospect software trials and serve as point of contact for related communication. Provide input into scope analysis and solution architecture for contract development as requested. Travel to industry conferences and events to foster industry relationships and develop leads. Implementation Duties Lead classroom or remote sessions to train clients on application functionality. Lead onsite or remote analysis sessions with clients to guide them through configuration and customization decisions in alignment with their business requirements. Successfully distinguish user requests from true underlying needs. Create and maintain project artifacts, such as configuration documents, business requirements documents, and functional specifications. Identifying, delegating/executing, and tracking the results of tasks that arise out of client discussions, to include configuration tasks, testing tasks, data mapping tasks, documenting tasks, general problem solving, etc., in alignment with a defined project schedule. Product Development Duties Participate in the development of the product roadmap, requirements and specification documentation. Work with development teams to translate product requirements into technical requirements. Analyze and critically evaluate industry product information gathered from multiple internal and external sources, reconcile findings, and decompose high-level information into product details for future product improvements. Work with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of any given project. This Position Requires You To: Be able to work at a pace required by a rapidly growing, profit-driven Ed Tech business. Be driven to acquire and internalize new information quickly. Possess a natural aptitude for software-supported business processes and design, to include an appreciation for formal logic and a genuine love of problem-solving. Feel comfortable speaking in front of small and large groups of people. Coordinate assigned work with other team members and follow up on delegated items. Possess an intrinsic passion to pursue assigned work to the highest personal ability and integrity. Be kind, flexible, proactive, and able to maintain productivity in the face of ambiguity. Appreciate a fast-paced environment in which no two days are the same. Fit into a group of highly integrated, highly communicative, fundamentally unpolitical and tightly knit but geographically dispersed team. Proactively analyze personal progress, project progress, potential risk areas, and proactively communicate that analysis to management. Be effective at working remotely, generally from home, serving primarily East Coast business hours but responsible for Coast-to-Coast time zones. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or 7 + years’ experience in Business Analysis. 5 + years’ experience in Research Administration and/or Compliance. Hands on experience with a research administration system. Active participation in at least one full-lifecycle implementation project. Superior written and oral communication skills. Exceptional presentation and meeting facilitation skills. Experience with and/or demonstrated ability in working as part of a geographically dispersed project team. First Consideration Will Be Given To Candidates With: Hands on experience with Streamlyne, Coeus, Cayuse SP, InfoEd or Click Commerce. Experience as lead on a Research Administration-related systems implementation. Experience in report writing at the enterprise level. SQL literacy. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Please send your resume and cover letter to careers@streamlyne.com along with the title of the position that you are applying for.

Senior Data Analyst, Business Intelligence - job post Cox Communications (part of Cox Enterprises) 3,448 reviews San Diego, CA $77,000 - $115,600 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $77,000 - $115,600 a year Job Type Full-time Senior Data Analyst Cox Communications, Inc. is seeking a Senior Data Analyst, Business Intelligence with experience in data acquisition/extraction and data blending geared towards but not limited to the telecommunications Industry. The Sales & Marketing Analytics & Reporting Team is looking for talented people who are incredibly passionate about data and have a proven track record of transforming raw data into business insight. We are looking for a rock star Data Engineer who will be responsible for researching and extracting pertinent data points within multiple source systems to empower our business intelligence platform. Your primary role is to be the co-designer, builder and keeper of data assets needed for reporting. This position is also responsible for supporting the data we enable, including managing our overnight batch processing starting at approx. 6:30 AM Eastern. We believe that great system performance and business insight is predicated by great data. So this role will be critical to the success of the team. What You'll Do Design and develop ETL workflows and datasets to be used by the BI reporting tool. ETL specific for creating datasets (to be used by MicroStrategy) Will write complex SQL queries with multiple joins to automate/manipulate these extracts Works in partnership with the other IT teams and stakeholders concerning the accuracy of data and efficiency of processes Prepare technical specifications and documentation for workflows supporting BI reports. Perform end to end Data validation to maintain accuracy of data sets Lead discussions with business partners to identify functional requirements resulting in data acquisition for BI applications Translate business logic from one system (Excel, SQL, etc) into SQL in a quick and accurate manner Develop re-useable processes that can be leveraged and standardized for multiple instances Understand the existing source system data models. Ensure application stability and performance by monitoring existing workflows to ensure they are working correctly and that they reconcile with the source. Provide ad-hoc data analysis and support to business functions. What's In It For You At Cox, we reward your hard work with meaningful benefits. First, we offer a competitive compensation package, 401(k) with a generous company match, comprehensive healthcare, life, and disability benefits, plus numerous other benefits, including adoption assistance, pet insurance, and discounts on travel and cars! We value people more than technology. That means you'll work within a culture and with a team that values your experience, your contributions, and you - yes, you - as a person. We believe recognition is important, and Cox strives to celebrate those who help make us successful every day. We also encourage diversity and support inclusion; we want you to do you and feel comfortable doing so. We also offer boundless opportunities for growth; you can sharpen your skills, learn a new talent, join a mentoring program, even earn an advanced degree. You'll find the potential for lateral or upward career growth within the Cox family businesses, including the innovative startups in transportation mobility, clean tech and more. Who You Are Minimum Bachelor's degree in a related discipline and 4 years' experience in a related field (Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Informatics, or similar analytical field.) The right candidate could also have a different combination, such as a master's degree and 2 years' experience; a Ph.D. and up to 1 year of experience; or 8 years' experience in a related field. Advanced knowledge of SQL, database technologies and data warehouse design philosophies Experience writing SQL queries against any RDBMS with query optimization and working with relational database systems Preferred Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent Experience using Hadoop, Snowflake, AWS or other big data/cloud platforms Advanced knowledge of self-service analytic/ETL tools, specifically SQL developer for Oracle. Join the Cox family of businesses and make your mark today! USD 77,000.00 - 115,600.00 per year About Cox Communications Cox Communications is the largest private telecom company in America, serving six million homes and businesses. That's a lot, but we also proudly serve our employees. Our benefits and our award-winning culture are just two of the things that make Cox a coveted place to work. If you're interested in bringing people closer through broadband, smart home tech and more, join Cox Communications today! About Cox Cox empowers employees to build a better future and has been doing so for over 120 years. With exciting investments and innovations across transportation, communications, cleantech and healthcare, our family of businesses - which includes Cox Automotive and Cox Communications - is forging a better future for us all. Ready to make your mark? Join us today! Benefits of working at Cox may include health care insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement planning (401(k)), and paid days off (sick leave, parental leave, flexible vacation/wellness days, and/or PTO). For more details on what benefits you may be offered, visit our benefits page .
